intro: Nesaea kuntzei, commonly known as the Kuntze's nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, preferring moist, acidic soils. Nesaea kuntzei is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
